Those who are dreaming of the day of 'Qayamat' will rot away; that day will never come."

content: While the male friend, her classmate, was untraceable, her father alleged that the man had tried to extort money from her by threatening to circulate her private photographs. The male friend is being treated as the main suspect, said police.

content: Randhawa said residents of Kashmir valley have encroached upon the land belonging to the Jammu Development Authority (JDA) in the city

title: Woman‚Äôs body found in box submerged in water tank in Bhopal, police begin probe
content: The body was found in a locality under the jurisdiction of Nishatpura police station in Bhopal on February 12, 2026

title: Pakistan captain adds fuel to handshake controversy - 'We‚Äôll find that out'
content: Pakistan captain Salman Ali Agha reignited the handshake controversy ahead of the India clash, saying he hopes for sportsmanship but adding, ‚ÄúWe‚Äôll find that out tomorrow.‚Äù India arrived in Colombo to a festive welcome and will train separately from Pakistan. Key Indian players are set to feature, with spin expected to play a big role. Agha had earlier criticised India‚Äôs past handshake refusal, calling it bad for the game and young fans.

title: Under-construction metro pillar collapses in Mumbai's Mulund West; 1 dead
content: A section of an under-construction metro rail pillar collapsed onto an autorickshaw in Mulund West on Saturday afternoon, with three to four individuals feared injured. The incident occurred near the Johnson & Johnson company on LBS Road when a cement segment gave way during ongoing work. Rescue operations are underway, and the injured are being transported to a hospital.

title: 'Power-sharing is essential': Cong presses DMK again after Stalin's red line in Tamil Nadu
content: Congress seeks more seats from DMK for the Tamil Nadu assembly elections. MP Manickam Tagore stated power sharing is essential for governance. DMK leader RS Raja Kannappan earlier claimed DMK would contest 170 seats. Formal alliance talks are set to begin on February 22. The INDIA bloc remains united despite BJP's efforts.

title: Meta slashes 1500 jobs in the workforce - Gives update on future layoffs
content: Meta has confirmed it will not repeat last year's company-wide performance purge, assuring employees that the bottom 5% cull is not an annual initiative. This comes after recent layoffs in its Reality Labs division, which has incurred significant losses. The company is now shifting its focus and investment towards AI research.

title: 'Don't know if they're serious': Rubio on Russia's intent to end Ukraine war
content: US secretary of state Marco Rubio expressed doubts about Russia's commitment to ending the Ukraine war, even as new peace talks loom.  Speaking at the Munich Security Conference, Rubio emphasized the need for "seriousness and reciprocity" from allies, while also reassuring Europe of strong transatlantic ties and a desire for a "reinvigorated alliance."

title: After CEO asked employees to stop coding, Nvidia engineers get access to OpenAI's Codex
content: Nvidia has deployed OpenAI's Codex AI coding tool to all 30,000 engineers, marking a significant enterprise rollout. CEO Jensen Huang's mandate to automate tasks with AI is driving this adoption, with engineers praising the tool's ability to handle complex workflows and maintain context.

title: Cisco president Jeetu Patel says company will never hire these developers
content: Cisco's president Jeetu Patel mandates AI for all developers, aiming for half a dozen AI-coded products by 2026. This shift to spec-driven development sees human teams shrink, with AI agents tripling output. While embracing AI's potential, Cisco is investing heavily in security to prevent rogue agents, urging developers to master AI to stay relevant.

title: Vikram Bhatt faces fresh non-payment allegations from '1920: Horrors of the Heart' crew
content: Filmmaker Vikram Bhatt and his wife received temporary bail in a Rs 30 crore fraud case. Following casting director Parag Chadha's allegations of non-payment, a crew member revealed she's owed Rs 20 lakh for her work on '1920: Horrors of the Heart'. Despite promises, significant dues remain unpaid, impacting the livelihoods of those involved.

title: Considering retirement at 28, Shadley is now top wicket-taker at 2026 T20 WC
content: Shadley van Schalkwyk has been the standout bowler at the T20 World Cup 2026, leading the wicket charts with 11 wickets in three matches. The USA all-rounder impressed against India and Pakistan, using smart variations to pick key wickets. His resurgence comes after years of struggles, injuries, and career setbacks, which shaped his mental toughness. Now 37, Schalkwyk is enjoying peak form and inspiring USA‚Äôs strong campaign.

title: Doctors explain the signs of magnesium deficiency
content: Subtle facial changes, like persistent eyelid twitches and dark circles, might signal magnesium deficiency, experts reveal. While common lifestyle factors often cause these, a lack of this vital mineral can impact nerve signaling and muscle relaxation. Doctors advise paying attention to these signs and consulting a professional for proper diagnosis and dietary adjustments.

title: 'Show that PM CARES': Congress books flight tickets for PM Modi to visit Manipur
content: Congress leader Pawan Khera criticized PM Modi for visiting Assam instead of Manipur, which has been experiencing unrest. Khera shared mock flight tickets from Guwahati to Imphal, urging the PM to visit the troubled state. This comes as Manipur faces renewed tensions and violent protests.

title: ‚ÄòLost control at 160 kmph‚Äô: How Bengaluru joyride turned fatal for 6 teens
content: A tragic accident occurred near Kambalipura Gate. A speeding SUV collided with a bike and then a truck. Seven lives were lost, including six students and a bike rider. The SUV was severely damaged. Another car later hit debris from the crash. The incident happened early Friday morning.

title: Big push for Assam: PM Modi inaugrates Rs 5,450 crore worth projects
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi launched a Rs 5,450 crore infrastructure drive in Assam, inaugurating the Kumar Bhaskar Varma Setu, a vital six-lane bridge, and the National Data Centre for the North Eastern Region.  He also inaugurated the Indian Institute of Management Guwahati and flagged off 225 electric buses, boosting connectivity, digital infrastructure, and higher education across the Northeast.

title: '$100,000 deal': What US justice department reveals about Pannun murder plot
content: An Indian national, Nikhil Gupta, has admitted guilt in a US court for orchestrating a $100,000 murder-for-hire plot against a US citizen. Prosecutors allege an Indian government employee directed the scheme targeting a Sikh separatist leader. Gupta's arrest in the Czech Republic led to his extradition and subsequent plea.

title: Happy valentine's day: 51 best valentine's day wishes and messages
content: Valentine's Day 2026 is here, a perfect occasion to celebrate love in all its forms. Whether you're expressing affection to a girlfriend, boyfriend, husband, or wife, the article offers a collection of heartfelt wishes. It also acknowledges singles embracing self-love and those celebrating with friends and family, encouraging everyone to pause and connect.

title: 'Bigger threat than any': Moeen Ali warns Pakistan ahead of India match
content: Former England all-rounder Moeen Ali warned Pakistan that India‚Äôs spinners, especially Kuldeep Yadav and Varun Chakravarthy, could be a major threat in the T20 World Cup clash. India received a festive welcome in Colombo, with Arshdeep Singh‚Äôs dance going viral. The team will rely on key batters like Hardik Pandya, Ishan Kishan and Tilak Varma, while Varun could be crucial on spin-friendly pitches.

title: US used Anthropic‚Äôs Claude AI model in Venezuela raid that captured Maduro: Report
content: Anthropic's AI model Claude was reportedly used in the US military operation that captured former Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro. The mission involved bombing sites in Caracas, with Maduro apprehended in an early January raid. This deployment highlights growing questions about AI's role in military contexts, despite Anthropic's usage policies prohibiting violence facilitation.

title: India's air power on display! PM Modi lands at Dibrugarh emergency landing facility, attends IAF show
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi arrived in Assam for a day-long visit, commencing with an aerial display by the Indian Air Force. He is set to inaugurate the Kumar Bhaskar Varma Setu, the first extradosed bridge in Northeast India, and the temporary campus of IIM Guwahati.

title: B'desh polls: Hardliner Jamaat's gains along India border set off security concerns
content: Alarm bells ring for India as hardline Jamaat-e-Islami and allies secure significant wins in Bangladesh border regions. This surge, the party's best in over two decades, fuels concerns about radicalization on both sides of the India-Bangladesh frontier. BJP highlights the historical ties between Jamaat and Pakistan, raising security anxieties for New Delhi.

title: ISL 2025-26: How FanCode's sub-licensing move solves the broadcast puzzle
content: Hours before kickoff, FanCode officially sub-licensed ISL‚Äôs TV rights to Sony Sports Network, opting for wider reach over exclusivity. The Dream Sports-owned digital-first platform prioritised accessibility and collaboration, ensuring broader audience coverage. The move underlines a growing trend of partnerships, not competition, may be key to expanding sports viewership in India.

title: 'Don‚Äôt think Abhishek is technically sound': Amir sparks fresh controversy
content: Former Pakistan pacer Mohammad Amir mocked Abhishek Sharma ahead of the India-Pakistan T20 World Cup clash, calling him a ‚Äúslogger‚Äù and questioning his technique. Abhishek is recovering from a serious stomach infection, with India captain Suryakumar Yadav giving a cautious fitness update, while Varun Chakravarthy sounded optimistic. Abhishek has travelled to Colombo and will undergo final fitness tests before the match.

title: Consumers to buy and sell electricity! DERC greenlights peer-to-peer power trading pilot
content: Delhi is set to revolutionize electricity consumption with a new framework enabling peer-to-peer energy trading. Prosumers with rooftop solar can now sell surplus power directly to other users, transforming homes into mini power plants. This pilot project, launching soon, aims to create a consumer-centric, digitally governed energy ecosystem.

title: 'Master at telling lies': Rahul slams PM Modi over India-US trade deal
content: Rahul Gandhi slammed the India-US trade deal, calling PM Modi 'Narendra Surrender Modi' and warning of harm to cotton farmers and textile exporters. He alleged a trap where India faces an 18% tariff on garments while Bangladesh gets 0% by importing US cotton, potentially hurting Indian farmers. Minister Piyush Goyal refuted these claims, stating farmers' interests are protected.

title: V-Day brings cheers for Q-comm brands: More shopping for jewellery, cards, and plush toys
content: Valentine's Day is driving a significant sales surge for quick commerce platforms and digital-first brands, with categories like sexual wellness, jewelry, and fashion experiencing substantial year-on-year growth.  Companies are activating special features and curated lists to capture increased demand, noting a shift towards planned, thoughtful gifting throughout Valentine's week.

title: India vs Pakistan: Where will the contest be won (or lost); what are the chances of rain?
content: Pakistan‚Äôs five-prong spin attack will be a challenge for India on a double-paced pitch at the R Premadasa Stadium in Colombo. Pakistan are likely to go with an all-spin attack against India. In that case, Sunday‚Äôs fixture will be crucial for Shivam Dube, who has been included in the side to take down spinners.

title: Graduated from IIT Madras in 2025: 22-yr-old Indian-origin student reported missing in US
content: Berkeley police are urgently seeking help to find Saketh Sreenivasaiah, a 22-year-old Indian Master's student from UC Berkeley, last seen Tuesday.  Authorities consider him an at-risk missing person.  Sreenivasaiah, who studied at IIT Madras, is described as 6'1" with short black hair and brown eyes.  Anyone with information is urged to contact law enforcement immediately.

title: Watch: Hardik spotted with girlfriend; Arshdeep dances on India's arrival in Colombo
content: Team India received a colourful welcome in Colombo ahead of the T20 World Cup clash with Pakistan, with Arshdeep Singh‚Äôs dance going viral and Hardik Pandya arriving with girlfriend Mahieka Sharma. India will rely on key players like Ishan Kishan, Suryakumar Yadav, Tilak Varma and Hardik, while Varun Chakravarthy could be crucial on spin-friendly Sri Lankan pitches.

title: Mahashivratri 2026: The most sacred items to offer to the Shivalinga
content: Mahashivratri, celebrated on February 15th, 2025, is a significant Hindu festival honoring Lord Shiva. Devotees express gratitude and seek blessings by offering sacred items like Bel Patra, water, Gangajal, sandalwood paste, honey, Dhatura, and white flowers. These offerings are believed to cleanse sins, purify the soul, and bring peace, love, and happiness into one's life.

title: This woman still gets Valentine‚Äôs flowers from her husband who died in 2017
content: Years after her husband John passed away, Diana Maver still receives a special Valentine's Day bouquet. John meticulously planned this surprise before his death, ensuring Diana would continue to receive her favorite red roses and white lilies annually. This thoughtful gesture, now carried out by their daughters, serves as a poignant reminder of their enduring love.

title: Slain Hindu man Dipu Das‚Äô kin votes in Bangladesh, calls for justice, accountability from new govt
content: A family in Mymensingh cast their votes hoping for justice after their son, Dipu Chandra Das, was burnt alive last December. Dipu, a garment worker, was attacked by a mob over alleged blasphemy. His father expressed hope that the newly elected government will expedite the justice process for his son.

title: 'Don 3' dispute: Producers Guild plans sit-down over Ranveer Singh‚ÄìFarhan Akhtar issue
content: A significant dispute has erupted between Ranveer Singh and Farhan Akhtar's production house over 'Don 3'. Following Singh's exit, the filmmakers are reportedly seeking ‚Çπ40 crore in compensation for pre-production expenses. The Producers Guild of India is set to mediate an informal meeting, with a potential escalation to CINTAA if a resolution isn't reached within ten days.

title: 'Likely caused by strangulation': Doctor who observed Epstein autopsy makes shock claim
content: Newly released Justice Department files reignite questions surrounding Jeffrey Epstein's death in a New York jail cell.  Despite being on suicide watch and under heightened surveillance, significant lapses in protocol occurred, including missed inmate counts and unreplaced cellmates.  The circumstances of his death remain a subject of scrutiny.

title: Leaders pay homage to 2019 Pulwama terror attack martyrs
content: A suicide bomber crashed his explosive-laden vehicle into a bus ferrying Central Reserve Police Force (CRPF) personnel on February 14, 2019, killing 40 jawans

title: Wild elephants kill six people in Hazaribagh
content: The incident took place at around 12:30 AM in Gondwar village on Friday, around 20 km from Hazaribagh under Churchu block when the villagers were sleeping.

title: ‚ÄòQuadrupled‚Äô seats in Parliament, will be ‚Äòvigilant‚Äô Opposition in Bangladesh: Ameer Shafiqur Rahman
content: The remarks of Jamaat-e-Islami leader came a day after the largest Islamist party of Bangladesh alleged that the election process had ‚Äúinconsistencies and fabrications‚Äù

title: Human deaths in encounter with elephants in Odisha, a cause of concern, says WSO
content: Odisha topped¬†human deaths in 2024-25 with¬†171 deaths, followed by Jharkhand (87), West Bengal (53), Assam (74) and Tamil Nadu (61), says the environmental pressure group

content: Chief Secretary V. Srinivas said the NABARD had carried out credit planning with the preparation of SFP for the next financial year to align financial institutions with the State‚Äôs development priorities

title: BJP hints at fielding three candidates for Rajya Sabha election from Odisha
content: BJP does not have requisite numbers in the State Assembly to ensure the election of third candidate to Upper House of Parliament

title: Major opportunities for AI in jobs and governance, says MeitY Secretary S. Krishnan
content: India is focusing on providing AI infrastructure that will spur development of applications, promoting electronics manufacturing with a thrust on semiconductors, and ensuring people secure adequate reskilling opportunities, says Secretary for the Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology S. Krishnan; he adds international cooperation on AI governance is being explored and the country has potential to be a leader in offering affordable technologies

title: West Bengal elections: CPI(M) MA Baby calls for ‚Äòsecular alliance‚Äô with Congress
content: This comes days after Congress announced that it will contest independently in all the 294 Assembly constituencies in West Bengal

title: TMC MP Abhishek meets family of Bengal migrant worker killed in Pune
content: The visit by Abhishek Banerjee to the residence of the deceased migrant worker comes a day after West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee termed the killing  of Sukhen Mahato in Maharashtra a ‚Äúhate crime‚Äù

title: Two arrested for allegedly raping and blackmailing minor in Bhopal
content: Shahjahanabad ACP Anil Bajpai says that the alleged assault took place between May and June last year after the prime accused, Ausaf Ali Khan, befriended the girl through mutual friends

title: Battle of prowess: wrestlers to fight it out for coveted silver mace in Bihar‚Äôs Jamui
content: Crafted in 1954, the mace has become a symbol of excellence in the sport since it was presented to wrestler Vishwanath Singh in 1975 on being conferred with the ‚ÄòBihar Kesari‚Äô title

title: U.P. is witnessing a model of renaissance under BJP regime, says Adityanath
content: State‚Äôs nine-year journey has seen change from crime to discipline, curfew to the rule of law, riots to celebrations, says CM responding to the discussion on the Governor‚Äôs address in the Assembly

title: Arundhati Roy withdraws from Berlin Film Festival amid Gaza row
content: Her statement comes after jury president Wim Wenders‚Äô response to a question on Gaza at a press conference, where he stated, ‚ÄúWe cannot really enter the field of politics,‚Äù calling filmmakers ‚Äúthe counterweight to politics‚Äù

title: Udhayanidhi felicitates film artistes, says awards chosen by committee

title: Six-year-old killed as car hits auto, pedestrians in Lucknow; accused held

content: Stranded workers sent a video to activist Sikander Ali on February 2, who shared it on social media, urging the Jharkhand government to help them return, as their passports were seized by the company

title: Legacy issues cast shadow on Hyderabad Metro Rail phase II plans

Outstanding debt, the Old City corridor, and withheld Viability Gap Funding may complicate Detailed Project Report clearance and financial settlement amid scrutiny and negotiations

title: British dentist‚Äôs emotional reunion with great‚Äëgrandfather‚Äôs grave ending family‚Äôs 119-year search
content: Decades-long family quest culminated in Secunderabad, where history, memory, and emotion converged at a Commonwealth War Graves cemetery, where Robin Dickson honoured his great-grandfather ‚Äî Lieutenant Charles Wilson ‚Äî closing a circle left incomplete for over a century

title: BJP accuses Rahul Gandhi of  ‚Äòpolitically uncivilised behaviour‚Äô

title: NLCIL secures NABL accreditation
content: The NLCIL said the accreditation enhances the company‚Äôs capability to support its mining, thermal power, and renewable energy operations through reliable in-house testing and R&D excellence

title: Another 6 lakh names may go from Bengal voter list
content: These voters did not appear for the hearings¬†under the SIR of electoral rolls despite notices being issued to them, say State Election Commission officials; 58 lakh names have already been deleted

title: Hasina‚Äôs presence in India, Ganga waters treaty to be key priorities for BNP government: sources
content: Sources in the Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) say India and Bangladesh have a settled border and ‚Äòit makes no sense to shoot to kill someone‚Äô; besides, they add that former PM Sheikh Hasina‚Äôs comments on Bangladesh‚Äôs internal affairs will pose a challenge to normalisation of ties

title: Telangana municipal polls: Fourth consecutive win for Congress in State since 2023
content: The latest victory in the municipal polls adds to Congress‚Äô success in the Assembly, Parliament and Panchayat elections, apart from two bypoll wins in constituencies vacated, following the untimely demise of sitting BRS MLAs

title: UFC at the White House explained
content: the event will be the first live professional sporting event on the white house on June 14 . it will be simulcast on CBS and Paramount+ . the announcement of which fighters will compete will continue as the date draws closer . white has credited the president with the idea to stage fights at the nation's capital .
